steps.title: AVERAGE Function Practice
steps.content:
Practice: Analyzing Group Sizes

Download and use the Sports day fundraiser file for these activities.

Create a new sheet named 'Average Practice':

Activity 1: Calculate Overall Average

Calculate the average group size across all bookings. Copy your formula and result to your 'Average Practice' sheet.

=AVERAGE(G2:G21)

Activity 2: Comparing Sports

Calculate the average donation amount for each sport separately. Copy your formulas and results to your 'Average Practice' sheet.

quiz.question: What is the average group size for all bookings?

steps.title: COUNTIF Function Practice
steps.content:
Practice: Analyzing T-Shirt Orders

Create a new sheet named 'Count Practice':

Activity 1: Size Count

Count how many people ordered each t-shirt size (S, M, L). Copy your formulas and results to your 'Count Practice' sheet.

=COUNTIF(E2:E21, "M")

Activity 2: Newsletter Signups

Count how many people signed up for the newsletter in each sport. Copy your formulas and results to your 'Count Practice' sheet.

quiz.question: How many people ordered size M T-shirts?

steps.title: IF Function Practice
steps.content:
Practice: Creating Categories

Create a new sheet named 'IF Practice':

Activity 1: Group Size Categories

Create a new column that categorizes groups as 'Small' (1-2 people) or 'Large' (3+ people). Copy your formula and results to your 'IF Practice' sheet.

=IF(G2<=2, "Small", "Large")

Activity 2: Group Status

Create a column that shows 'Newsletter' for people who signed up, 'No Newsletter' for those who didn't. Copy your formula and results to your 'IF Practice' sheet.

quiz.question: What will =IF(G2<=2, "Small", "Large") return for a group of 3 people?

steps.title: Conditional Formatting Practice
steps.content:
Practice: Visual Analysis

Create a new sheet named 'Format Practice':

Activity 1: Highlight Large Groups

Apply conditional formatting to highlight groups larger than 3 people in red. Copy your formatted data to your 'Format Practice' sheet.

  1. Select column G (How many attending)
  2. Click Conditional Formatting in the Home tab
  3. Choose 'Highlight Cell Rules' â†’ 'Greater Than'
  4. Enter 3 and choose 'Red Fill'

Activity 2: colour Scale

Apply a colour scale to show the distribution of group sizes, using a green-to-red gradient. Copy your formatted data to your 'Format Practice' sheet.HINT: Play around with the options in Conditional Formatting.

quiz.question: Which groups will be highlighted in red using the conditional formatting rule 'greater than 3'?
